projectGridLines.title: Title: Autonomous connected electronics: ADAS, Mobile Robotics & Defence.
projectGridLines.description:
1. Title: Autonomous connected electronics: ADAS, Mobile Robotics & Defence.

             

Description:  Project will be in following functional areas:

  • Embedded Hardware Development
  • Embedded Firmware Development
  • Software  development in the following areas:
  • Robotics control, Perception, Path Planning and Navigation, Slam.
  • Fleet Management
  • System Integration


  • Skill sets:  
  • Basic Tech skill required: C/C++, ROS, Python, Linux, / machine learning methods/computer vision methods etc.


  • Passionate about Robotics, Industrial automation, keen to work on software and hardware implementations.

Expected learning: Embedded hardware development: You can expect to learn about the physical components of robots, such as sensors, motors and controllers, circuit design, PCB layout and other hardware related skills. 2. Embedded firmware development: In this, you will learn about the programming languages such as C/C++, embedded system design, real time operating systems and firmware testing and debugging. 3. Robotics control, Perception, Path Planning and Navigation, Slam: These are all software development areas that are crucial for building autonomous robots. You can expect to learn about algorithms for sensing and processing data from sensors, designing and implementing path planning and navigation systems and using SLAM algorithms to map and localize robots. 4. Fleet Management: It involves developing software to manage fleets of robots, such as coordinating tasks, scheduling, network protocols and database design. 5. System Integration: It involves bringing together all the different components including hardware, firmware, software, you can expect to learn about system architecture, software design patterns and testing and debugging techniques.


Specific courses required for project execution: N/A
